com.adobe.cq.social.tally

Interface Tally<T extends ResponseValue>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The response value object that a tally will keep track of
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Liking, Poll, RatingComponent, Voting

    public interface Tally<T extends ResponseValue>
    A tally is a resource that can keep count or tally of a set of user responses on a specific target resource.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      boolean canUserRespond()
      checks if the current logged in user has privileges to respond to this tally (based on ACLs).

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        the name of this tally

      • getTotalNumberOfResponses

        java.lang.Long getTotalNumberOfResponses()
        Returns:
        count of number of users who responded to this tally

      • getUserResponse

        Response<T> getUserResponse(java.lang.String userId)
                     throws TallyException,
                            RepositoryException
        Parameters:
        userId - the user for whom the response is requested for
        Returns:
        the response of the current user. null if the user has not responded
        Throws:
        TallyException - when there was an error in reading the users latest response
        RepositoryException - when there is a JCR error in reading the users latest response

      • getCurrentUserResponse

        T getCurrentUserResponse()
                  throws TallyException
        Returns:
        the response of the current user. null if the user has not responded
        Throws:
        TallyException - when there was an error in reading the users latest response

      • getResponses

        java.util.Iterator<Response<T>> getResponses(java.lang.Long start,
                                             int numberOfResponses)
        Parameters:
        start - the beginning index which to return the responses from
        numberOfResponses - the number of responses to be returned
        Returns:
        a list of responses

      • getResponses

        java.util.Iterator<Response<T>> getResponses(java.lang.Long start)
        Parameters:
        start - the beginning index which to return the responses from
        Returns:
        a list of responses

      • getResponseTallies

        java.util.Map<T,java.lang.Long> getResponseTallies()
        Returns:
        a map of each response value to the count of number of users who have chosen the value. Example: [Helpful -> 4, Unhelpful ->5], [5-stars -> 3, 4-stars -> 2, 1-star -> 4]

      • getTallyTarget

        Resource getTallyTarget()
        Returns:
        the resource for which this tally is being maintained

      • setUserResponse

        Resource setUserResponse(java.lang.String userId,
                         java.lang.String responseValue)
                  throws TallyException,
                         RepositoryException
        sets the user response for this tally in jcr.
        Parameters:
        userId - the authorizable id of the user who responded to the tally
        responseValue - the response value entered by the user for the tally
        Returns:
        the Resource object representing the response
        Throws:
        TallyException - when there is an error in setting the user response
        RepositoryException - when there is a JCR error in setting the user response

      • setUserResponse

        Resource setUserResponse(java.lang.String userId,
                         java.lang.String responseValue,
                         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> additionalPoperties)
                  throws TallyException,
                         RepositoryException
        sets the user response for this tally in jcr.
        Parameters:
        userId - the authorizable id of the user who responded to the tally
        responseValue - the response value entered by the user for the tally
        additionalPoperties - any additional properties to write to the resource; may be null
        Returns:
        the Resource object representing the response
        Throws:
        TallyException - when there is an error in setting the user response
        RepositoryException - when there is a JCR error in setting the user response

      • unsetUserResponse

        Resource unsetUserResponse(java.lang.String userId)
                    throws TallyException,
                           RepositoryException
        unsets the user response in jcr. Theoretically, this is like deleting the user response
        Parameters:
        userId - the authorizable id of the user who responded to the tally
        Returns:
        the Resource object representing the node that indicates an unset response
        Throws:
        TallyException - when there is an error in trying to unset the user response
        RepositoryException - when there is a JCR error in setting the user response

      • canUserRespond

        boolean canUserRespond()
        checks if the current logged in user has privileges to respond to this tally (based on ACLs).
        Returns:
        true if user has privileges, false otherwise or if no user is logged in

      • canUserRespond

        boolean canUserRespond(SlingHttpServletRequest request)
        checks if the current logged in user has privileges to respond to this tally (based on ACLs). This can track the client context.
        Parameters:
        request - the sling request to use as the basis of the user determination
        Returns:
        true if user has privileges, false otherwise or if no user is logged in

      • setTallyResourceType

        void setTallyResourceType(java.lang.String resourceType)
        Parameters:
        resourceType - - the resource type to use when creating tally component resource nodes if needed in ugc.

      • getUseReferrerUrl

        boolean getUseReferrerUrl()
        Check if the tally is using referrerUrl for its AbstractTally.getFriendlyUrl() or not.
        Returns:
